Disaster risk reduction (including linkage to climate change)
Public health emergencies, including disease outbreaks
Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management

related-activity.ref: 0990/A0/06/005 PREPARATION A L URGENCE ET TRANSITION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: EBOLA - APPUI AUX COMMUNAUTES AFFECTEES

description.narrative: Pillar 3 delivers a complimentary Ebola response that addresses the significant social and humanitarian problems of the communities affected by the crisis. Its interventions contribute to strengthening resilience of communities while reducing their vulnerabilities, setting the basis for development work post-Ebola. Launched in June 2019, the Pillar 3 made good strides in working with local partners in volatile areas with limited access and acceptability to restore some basic social services and gained community trust which facilitated the programme delivery. | Status:Met | As-of Date:05/02/2020

title.narrative: Number of health facilities supported (training, rehabilitation, equipment) in areas affected by EVD or at risk.
Number of CAC members trained in communication techniques and essential family practices.
Number of children (6-59 months) vaccinated against measles in affected and at-risk zones.
Number of school-age boys and girls (aged 5 to 17 years) living in areas affected by EVD or at risk and receiving learning materials.
Number of children treated for SAM in UNTA and UNTI in health zones affected by EVD or at risk.
Number of students (aged 5 to 17 years) in schools in areas affected by EVD who received a water, hygiene and sanitation intervention (disaggregated by gender).
Number of children (6-59 months) who were dewormed (12-59 months).
Number of children (6-59 months) who received vitamin A.
Number of children vaccinated (0-59 months) during polio campaigns in areas affected by EVD or at risk (disaggregated by gender).
Number of people who have improved access to water, hygiene and sanitation in areas affected by EVD or at risk.
